page.title: 17Faldingworth Grange
page.content: The Grange is a 360 acre farm belonging to J.A.Carter & Sons. An additional 105 acres are rented. Four people are employed. The number of livestock for 1985 are: cattle 85, geese 25, horses 2, pigs 1 and Christmas poultry 650. 30 acres are permanent pasture. Crops grown in the 1985 season are, wheat 250 acres, barley 70 acres and oilseed rape 115 acres. The soil is a heavy clay. Some nearby farms on lighter soils include root crops, especially potatoes, and peas in their rotation systems. They have 1 fork lift, 1 baler, 1 sub soiler, 1 combine, 9 tractors and 5 drills. Also they hire a straw chopper. In the Autumn they contract drill for other farms in the area. Their fan for drying cereals is driven by a tractor. It is on for 10 to 12 hours for about 10 weeks.
